 Professional Summary  
Mechanical equipment and package engineer specialising in fired 
equipment for the Oil and Gas and Petrochemical Industries. 
Extensive experience on a wide range of upstream and downstream 
projects.  Specific refinery experience includes PetroPlus Cressier,  
Chevron Pembroke, BP Coryton and KNPC MAA and MAB. 
Knowledge of international codes related to boilers,  WHRUs, HRSGs,  
fired heaters and burners: NFPA, API, TRD, ASME and BS. 
Approximately ten years’ experience with a major boiler 
manufacturer as a technic al services engineer on both Benson and 
drum boilers, which included technical investigations and 
commissioning, and as a technical services engineer attached to 
client utility company. Commissioning engineer on other plant 
including fired heaters and expe rience on audits and technical 
investigations of waste heat boilers.  
Qualifications  
Education  
OND, Engineering, South Shields Marine and Technical College  
Apprenticeship, Fitter, Unilever  
HNC, Mechanical Engineering, Carlett Park College  
BSc, Mechanical Engineering,  Liverpool Poytechnic    
MSc, Engineering, Liverpool University  
Registrations / Certifications / Licenses  
Member of the Institution  of Mechanical Engineering / Chartered 
Engineer  
Languages  
 English  (native)  
Experience  
Principal Mechanical Engineer, Vari ous Projects (Jan 
2009 – February 2020 ) 
Fired heater equipment engineer on the KIPIC Al Zour refinery 
project , Crude and Bitumen Unit and Alternative Feed Unit for HPU 
at MAA refinery . Reviewed and approved contractor engineering 
deliverables , to ensure compliance with contract. Provided guidance 
to contractor where required to meet client requirements. 
Responded to and resolved technical queries.  
Advised Xcite -Bentley on offshore FPSO WHRUs a nd equipment 
engineer on the DANA Petroleum/COSCO F PSO, including time at 
the COSCO shipyard in Xidong, China.  
  
Donald Lawlan   
 Principal Mechanical Engineer  
 
  
May 2019    Page 2 of 5  
 
Experience  
 
Fired heater equipment engineer on the Tamarack HTL ™ FEED and responsible for the specification of 
vacuum charge fired heaters, waste heat boiler, low pressure burners and duct burners. Included studies of 
coking propensities of an existing vacuum charge heater in Europe, compliance with low -NOx emissions 
Canadian regulations and fuel gas change -over.  
Fired equipment engineer on Ichthys/INPEX FEED for the specification of FPSO fired heaters (‘D -type’ marine 
boilers in heating medium service) and waste heat recovery units. Other projects include providing adv ice on 
the fired heaters upgrade on Gas Trains 1, 2 & 3 at KIPIC MAA refinery in Kuwait and advising on technical 
aspects related to elevated and ground flares on the Shell CORRIB project including calculation of convective 
heat transfer to surrounding equ ipment.  
Completed specifications and data sheets for Claus reactor, WHB and SCOT tail gas burner for the Petroplus, 
Cressier refinery. Completed FEED specifications for 3 -off re -gen gas fired heaters for KIPIC MAA refinery in 
Kuwait.  
Fired heater equipme nt engineer on the Tamarack HTL ™ pre-FEED and fired heater engineer on JO -KOC 
FEED for the specification of elevated flares and HTF fired heaters on the Wafra field. A particular detail was 
dealing with the high ppm H 2S fuels. In 2008 he was responsible fo r the specification of heater treaters and 
burners for the En -Naga, Libya, project FEED study.  
 
Lead Mechanical Equipment Engineer, Pembroke Refinery (Jul 2007 - Jan 2009)  
Seconded to Chevron (UK), Pembroke Refinery, for eighteen months, as Chevron Lead Me chanical Equip
